website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for dogs on a grain-free diet.
pros: Available in 3 tasty, meaty flavors: turkey, beef, and salmon
The grain-free recipe is ideal for dogs with allergies and digestive issues
Kibbles are full of quality ingredients, but they sit at a reasonable price point
cons: Smaller dogs may struggle with the large sized kibbles

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the two different bags
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware, this is the only food my dog will eat, however there is a issue with what i received. The light color bag the dogs got sick from it and now won't even go near it, something is wrong with the food. they will eat the food in the more orange color bag which is the replacement bag Amazon just sent me which I received today. Hope Rachael Ray sees this and handles this issue. See photo!
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: DEADLIEST Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: *BEWARE! This dog food about killed our family dog. Every organ system in her body began to fail simultaneously and her red blood cell count went to a dangerous low just a week after starting this bag - a sign of toxicity. Our ER bill was $2500. There are HUNDREDS of other cases reported from this dog food - dogs in the ER or dead from consumption of Rachel Ray dog food. Check out the recent class action lawsuit. Amazon assured me that they would remove the product immediately. They did not and have failed to offer any compensation for the pain and suffering our family endured. If you want your dog to LIVE, don’t buy this food.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: CHANGED THE SIZE OF THE KIBBLE
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrified, my dog will not eat this new sized kibble now. The top kibble is from an old bag (purchased a month ago at Petco) and the bottom kibble is what we got in the mail last week. We've bought this dog food for the past 12 months and it's always been a small sized kibble - which is exactly the reason why we chose this food. The manufacturers have changed the size of the kibble without any warning and I've just bought 28 POUNDS of this... Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina S.

customer_reviews.title: My sweet fur baby itched
customer_reviews.text: My sweet fur baby itched, itched, itched and was miserable. The vet suggested I go to "grain free". As luck would have it ,RR Nutrish Zero Grain Natural Dry Dog Food was the first to meet the dietary requirement plus my frugal inclinations. AND when it arrived Miss Sophie said "Yes". Now, after a week or two, her itching has disappeared and Sophie likes the food. As a travel-hindered old girl, Amazon plus Rachel Ray has made life easier and made my little pound puppy happy. Very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Kindle CustomerGran

customer_reviews.title: Good product, price ok
customer_reviews.text: Good quality dog food. We prefer grain free and had been using Taste of the Wild for a year or so. The cost was getting astronomical, so our vet tech recommended Rachael Ray's grain free dog food. Our dog loves it, and I love that I can buy it pretty much anywhere (grocery store, drug store, etc). The price here is nothing special- I can buy it at our local grocery store for $2 less. I only purchased it here because we had a large Amazon gift card to use up.
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: but this one seems to be her favorite. It does lose it's flavor after a while ...
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food, especially fresh opened bags! She goes crazy! We've tried other flavors, but this one seems to be her favorite. It does lose it's flavor after a while so I recommend putting it into a seal-able container to preserve it longer! Your dog will thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Janelle S.

customer_reviews.title: High quality food, but dogs are finicky with this one
customer_reviews.text: My dogs liked it "okay", but I was having to add pumpkin or sweet potatoes on top to get them to eat it right away. They would eventually eat it otherwise, but not until they were really hungry. Also, one of my dogs still had digestive issues eating this food. I've since switched to a different food and she's doing much better with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kris H

customer_reviews.title: Kibble Size Has Changed
customer_reviews.text: I love this food for my dog. She loves it too. It’s been her main meal for several years now. I have always been completely happy with it, up until now. Starting around a month ago, the kibble size almost tripled. There was no mention of a new kibble size on the package, either. The weight of the bag has not changed. My dog liked the smaller kibble better.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Don‘t Buy It !!
customer_reviews.text: Please DO NOT buy it!!!!!!!! so REGRET that I didn't read customer reviews !!!!!! I got 28lb Turkey & Potato in light color bag and my dog will not even go near it........ Absolutely horrible...... But at least my dog wasn't KILLED by it like some others in customer reviews... please give customers a explaination!!!!!!!!!!! can't let more people waste their money and put their dogs in danger!!!! can't believe Amazon and Rachael Ray Nutrish are keeking selling this kind of products after they got so many problems and issues in feedback!!!! what are they waiting for??? a letter from lawyers???
customer_reviews.author: Fiona

customer_reviews.title: It could be that our dogs had a wheat allergy ...
customer_reviews.text: It could be that our dogs had a wheat allergy and this was the first brand we tried, but using Rachael's Zero Grain cleared our labs within 2 weeks!! We are scared to try anything else because it's fixed!! "DON'T BREAK IT!" The ONLY reason I gave it 4 stars is: Having two dogs, I wish the bags came in higher pounds per shipment. It's a pain having to order/store 2 at a time per month. Or if amazon could allow a large bag every 2-3 weeks (with discount) instead of just once a month. BUT this HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH THE PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: Cla

customer_reviews.title: My 3 pugs thrive on this food!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 pugs (17, 10, and 6 year old males) love this food and have thrived on it for several months now. My boys are extremely allergic to grains and fillers and kick and chew incessantly on foods with those ingredients. They have been free of skin allergies since I switched to Zero Grain. I did have to adjust their portions, however, because they got a bit portly on this food. But then again they are pugs!
customer_reviews.author: regina cheek

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: i love racheal ray products. they are taste tested (like a bride) each product, and is believable given how she dotes on her own dog and feeds only quality product(s). saw her claim on her show - very convincing and given my dog (and as a puppey) is fed this, she is thriving and LOVES her food - and the treats. (treats are the bomb). highly recommend any of her products-did my research before even getting a puppy and she is in the top 5 by many sites and quality review boards. - kudos to amazon for the usual early delivery - timing is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: t2

customer_reviews.title: My dog has loved this from a pup to now at 7 years old.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe my dog is bias because she grew up on it. But after moving and going through a divorce I changed her food up a bit because divorce isn't cheap... but yeah, used an alternative brand that was still brainless and she would only eat when she absolutely had to ie not die =_= as soon as I switched her back she ate it right away. Also found out the other dogs my parents own love her food, but they're 80+lbs gsds and I can't afford it for all of them. Got them some toppers to help get through their food until it's time to buy more then I'll have parents try Rachel's food out.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: Deceiving ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My dog started eating this since this summer and he started having allergic reactions. It was my fault for not reading the ingredients carefully but if you’re going to claim it’s turkey and potato then those should be the first ones instead of having chicken meal as one of the top ingredients (which is what most dogs are allergic to) Going to have to switch to something else that doesn’t have chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Coleman

customer_reviews.title: selling different food on original bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for couple months and was great for my dog the last ship I noticed different size on the product the smell it's different the dog cannot eat I don't know what happened ,,Walmart sale the same brand and is the correct on the top on picture larger is good food ,
customer_reviews.author: alessandro

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dog food thinking it would be a good choice for my dog, this made him sick all the time-eating grass to make himself throw up almost everyday, diarrhea...it was awful. Ended up having to switch my dog to Blue Buffalo food and it solved all of his problems instantly. No more sickness. Wouldn’t recommend this food!
customer_reviews.author: Ariana

customer_reviews.title: My dogs just won't eat it.
customer_reviews.text: I set this up on auto order and had to cancel it. I have 3 large dogs. Two Labrador retrievers and a Standard poodle. Not one of them would eat it. They literally starved their selves. My chocolate lab has gluten issues. I've always do use Rachael Ray's dog food so I figured zero green would be a good choice. Boy was I wrong. I have two bags that they won't touch. Never have I seen a dog refusing to eat something when it's the only choice. We had to run to our local store to get the other bag.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Fryman

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy !!
customer_reviews.text: My dog got sick eating this from Amazon. He has been eating zero grain food after being diagnosed as intolerant if it by the vet. We have bought this for two years from pet shops with no problems and we have bought a couple of bags from amazon due to coronavirus shopping difficulties. My dog is constantly scratching and has patches of hair missing from all over. The only difference has been the supplier of the food. Perhaps amazon have been given a bad batch? Either way don’t get it if you love your pet.
customer_reviews.author: Susan sadler

customer_reviews.title: Good value lower tier dog food
customer_reviews.text: Good value for price. My dogs will eat this but it’s not their favorite. Quality ingredients for the price. My German Shepherd can only eat Turkey base dry dog food because of his digestive issues. Turkey base are known to be a little easier for dogs to handle. This particle brand still gives my German Shepherd loose stool but at least it’s not diarrhea. I would prefer to buying higher quality but money is tight right now due to covid. Rachel Ray brand will have to do for now.
customer_reviews.author: Bao

customer_reviews.title: Bag busted inside box
customer_reviews.text: The bag was cut open within the box and dog food had spilled out all in the box. The box was not damaged. Not even sure how I would go about returning. Just going to use what is left in the bag because of course I needed the dog food to feed them. A little disappointed that the bag was busted.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I did purchase a moisturizer for him as well later on - because he wasn't treated the best before we got him - but this sure started ...
customer_reviews.text: Within 3 days of starting my rescue Rottweiler on this, his coat stopped shedding. Daughter in law asked if I'd given puppy a bath - major improvement! I did purchase a moisturizer for him as well later on - because he wasn't treated the best before we got him - but this sure started him off on the right paw!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Lee

customer_reviews.title: Wrong product unedible
customer_reviews.text: Received the wrong product!!! The originally ordered my Dog loved and had no problems. Received a green bag with multi colored kibble, he scratched and acted lethargic after 2 days (I was in a pinch) but my Baby comes first. He wont even go near it now, threw it away pronto.😡
customer_reviews.author: Robin kirk

customer_reviews.title: allergic
customer_reviews.text: Henny was allergic to something in it so I had to switch to another brand of food. Verdict still out on that one??? This didn't pass muster as poor Henny broke out with a really bad rash/hives and had an upset tummy. No go....
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: Personally i like the food
customer_reviews.text: Personally i like the food. the ingredients. My dog loves it. She is a small dog and the pieces are larger than normal, but even with hardly any teeth she gobbles it down. I just put the tiniest bit of water in with it, but lets be honest they swallows the bits whole anyway. (like a princess) Thank you Rachel Ray for a good food. Please don't sell out to a company that will change it and make it horrible. :)
customer_reviews.author: movies_music_fan

customer_reviews.title: A dog food with real in
customer_reviews.text: I originally selected the brand Nutrish becuz it’s promoted by Rachel Ray who is an advent advocate for animals and believes in natural wholesome ingredients but I stopped becuz I had observed the dog bags of food were greasy. BUT not anymore. The food is fresh and not fill of fillers. My dog has severe allergies and she eats the Salmon selection of dry goods. I totally recommend for dogs who are sensitive and suffer from allergies.
customer_reviews.author: sue says

customer_reviews.title: Itchy Pup
customer_reviews.text: Made my dog itchy :( He hasn't stopped scratching since i gave it to him.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: A lot of proteins come from peas but that's how they keep the price down
customer_reviews.text: As stated in the review of this food on Dog Food Advisor site, this has quite a lot of PLANT based proteins (from peas). That is how they manage to have a relatively low price on a zero grain food. Dog Food Advisor gives it 4 stars. I would give 5 because well you get what you pay for. Some animal protein rich dog foods out there are a lot more pricy. It smells quite good, my dog (5 year old pitbull) loves it and never had issues.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Great limited ingredient food
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yo Australian labradoodle had GI issues for the first two years of his life. We tried different foods, and he'd do well for awhile, then have a problem. Last year we switched to this one, and he's been on it for over a year now and no issues. I think it's a great food and I'd recommend anyone try it if they're looking for a new food.
customer_reviews.author: Pink Paisley

customer_reviews.title: Invest in your dog's health
customer_reviews.text: My vet has been recommending this food for me for a while now, so I finally decided to switch to it and I'm happy I did. The ingredients are much healthier than most name brand ones you find at your local stores. I can tell my dog's coat has been healthier since she started eating this. Plus, if you use Amazon's 'subscribe and save' option, it makes it more affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Burns

customer_reviews.title: Might work for some but not us.
customer_reviews.text: When we got our golden retriever puppy at 8 weeks old he was already eating this food. So I kept him on it; it's affordable and he ate it well. However, nearly 7 months later and he was still having accidents in the house and in his crate. He had constant gas and seemed to poop an unusual amount. His stools were also looser. I realized this is a high fiber food and it may be upsetting him. Switched to a new food and it's been night and day difference. No more accidents, way less poop. This food may work okay for some but if you start having these symptoms I would switch.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Miller

customer_reviews.title: My dog will eat it
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is so spoiled. I'm pretty sure he lives off of the treats he's given all day long. Most dogs when you feed them they eat their food up pretty quickly. My dog just grazes because he knows there's another treat right around the corner. Having said that, he has become a pretty picky eater. For the most part, he doesn't like dog food but he'll eat this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Mayer

customer_reviews.title: A Great Dog Food As Dry Dog Foods Go
customer_reviews.text: Only based on how my 10-year old dog eats it or rather gobbles it down, I have to admit that it must taste good. And, since it is grain free, it is a great dog food, although the latest news says all dry dog food is not necessarily as good as one might believe. However, as dry dog foods go, it is very good with great ingredients. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: GreatAmazonBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expect
customer_reviews.text: Due your research before you feed grain free dog food to your dog. My dogs did not like the taste therefore they decided to barely eat. They also got very constipated. One of my dogs with diagnosed with heart disease during the time of eating this. I should have done my research and urge you to do yours before trying any grain free dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Alaskan Angel

customer_reviews.title: He's been so much better on this food
customer_reviews.text: We have a Beagle that's allergic to many things and requires a grain free dog food. We had tried MANY grain free foods throughout the last couple of years but this one is the winner! Our Beagle loves it! He's been so much better on this food. I wish we would have found it a long time ago. Even though other brands claim to be "grain free" the Rachel Ray brand seems to have less ingredients compared to the other grain free brand we were using.
customer_reviews.author: Braden

customer_reviews.title: Bad bag of food!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to throw this whole bag of food away!! I noticed it smelled very rancid and didn't seem right. I've never used this food before so I thought maybe this was how this brand smelled. Wrong!! My dog ate it for 2 days and got very sick!! Throwing up all night. Luckily I had added cooked food with it or it would have been worse. Very disappointed. This was not a cheap bag of food and I had to throw the whole bag away.
customer_reviews.author: yvonne cosio

customer_reviews.title: The only food that doesn't make my dog sick!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 3 year old lab/pitt mix. I've tried many different brands of dog food and every other one has given her some sort of digestive issue. The zero grain is great for combating inflammation. She also loves the taste, so much so that we can use the kibble as treats rather than buying separate ones. Her coat is also very shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Rdtoserenity

customer_reviews.title: My dog liked it but his stools seemed too soft
customer_reviews.text: I got this after trying a different Rachel Ray dog food that had corn. My dog liked it but his stools seemed too soft. I got this thinking maybe he has a corn allergy. His stools are normal now so I think the corn was the problem. He likes this food but doesn't love it (but is also not a super food oriented dog) and doesn't always finish his bowl. Overall I think this is a good affordable dog food and I will buy it again
customer_reviews.author: fc

customer_reviews.title: great food at  great price
customer_reviews.text: our pit bull mix has allergies to beef and fish. She loves this food. After paying a very high price for a limited ingredient food, I found this just the same and half the cost! I added it to a button and all have to do is push it and the next day the food is at my front door . Beats lugging it from the pet store
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my dogs allergies right up
customer_reviews.text: My sweet pups were FOREVER itching their ears. And to the vet. And buy the medicine. And and and. Never ending. And itchy eyes too. Well, switching to this food solved it all. Fast. YAY! I'm a loyal customer. Have it on auto subscribe so I am never without. Dogs love the taste. I love that they're not hurting anymore. Win win. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca G.

customer_reviews.title: Great price and our dog 🐶 loves it❤️
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price👍🏻 Our dog 🐶 loves❤️ Rachel Rays food,the soft and hard food.We purchased 2 bags,because it was a great price.We had to wait a little longer for it to be delivered,as it kept getting delayed, but that’s expected,right now,with all going on in the world and I truly appreciate Amazons great service❤️
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Jean Sayles

customer_reviews.title: Huge "bites" and not tasty enough for my dogs...
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the price and the ingredient list for this product, and had high hopes for my two small dogs with allergy and food sensitivies, Unfortunately, they don't show you the size of the morsels in this package, which are about the width of a dime. Whether it was the size of the food or the taste, my dogs did not like it and I ended up throwing away about 2/3 of the package. I switched to Walmarts Pure Balance chicken and rice formula (very highly rated by vets) and my dogs love it.
customer_reviews.author: KML

customer_reviews.title: bad bag
customer_reviews.text: Have been using for year... but must of got a bad bag... dog would not eat... returned to taste of the wild
customer_reviews.author: ember

customer_reviews.title: Kibbles are incredibly hard.
customer_reviews.text: It might have been this batch, I am not sure, but the food it incredibly hard. We even put it in the food processor to break it up and it still didn't work. Dogs could not eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Cally L Rempis

customer_reviews.title: Too hard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my for Yorkie because she has dry skin and I wanted a grain free food but the food was too hard and big for her to eat so much so that she stopped eating... I ended up changing her back to her current food is smaller and softer...Now I have a full opened bag of food that I can't use...
customer_reviews.author: ER_RN

customer_reviews.title: Dogs refused
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have loved other Rachel Ray dog kibble, but this one was refused by all three, even Old Sam who eats anything! I've tried adding broth, milk, and blended with other kibble they like, and they mostly just eat around this. Don't know why, too bad.
customer_reviews.author: catviews

customer_reviews.title: Almost killed my dog
customer_reviews.text: Had to get my lab off this food. He started drooling all the time and when I stopped feeding this food he stopped drooling. He was lethargic and his mouth broke out in sores. Never use this again.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Burney

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love this and im happy to give it to them!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this and im happy to give it to them! I feel comfortable with the ingredients and my dogs don't have any issues with this find. They are both sensitive and many foods made them sick before we found this one. The price isn't terrible either!
customer_reviews.author: Maria Kally

customer_reviews.title: Affordable way to keep your dog healthy!
customer_reviews.text: My Siberian Husky has a severe allergy to greens, and this is about the most affordable option to help him out. We used to use a brand called pure balance made by Walmart, but this is much better quality and cost just a dollar more. He's been on it for over a month and has had no skin issues or if sheen or hotspots. Highly recommended even if your dog doesn't have allergy problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Very nutritious.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say that this is the only dog food my dog will eat because he will eat just about anything, but this is very nutritious for him. I add a little warm water, let it sit for a couple of minutes and then stir it. Makes a nice gravy!
customer_reviews.author: K. Bogan

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as high end grain free with a fraction of the cost
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about trying a new grain free dog food with my dogs. But I was in a pinch, needed a bag ASAP and this was one of the only ones that shipped fast. I’m happy to say that my dogs seem to love the dog food, and they have not had any reactions to this dog food. It’s about half the cost of the regular dog food I was getting them. Looks like I’ll be buying this again!
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: This dog food is poison! DO NOT BUY IT!
customer_reviews.text: This food made both of my dogs so incredibly sick. Within 2 days of us switching to this food my dogs were vomiting and having constant diarrhea. By day two they were pooping BLOOD!!!!! They were not themselves both lethargic and we had to hydrate them with pedialyte and feed them pumpkin and rice. I’m praying that they pull through and survive this if not I am suing the crap out of this company!!!! Now I’m reading how sick it’s making dogs SHAME ON YOU RACHEL RAY AND AMAZON for not immediately taking this off the market!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David Plasencia

customer_reviews.title: He likes it
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my Boston Terrier Rachael Ray for almost a year Now & he loves it. But he's also spoiled so I have to switch flavors every month. He was getting tired of nutrish dish so I switched him to this zero grain one & he likes it even more. I just gotta keep switching the flavor up for his boujee self
customer_reviews.author: Fitz Roy

customer_reviews.title: Same ingredients as the higher priced dog food
customer_reviews.text: I use to feed them Blue Buffalo. Which is pricey. My Puppers didn’t really care for it. So I started comparing. Rachel Ray. Same ingredients as other higher priced dog food ,but affordable. My Puppers love it! They have been eating the Turkey and Potato for over a year.
customer_reviews.author: Shonda L

customer_reviews.title: Beware don’t feed this unless your dog has been diagnosed with grain allergies
customer_reviews.text: Fed to my dog for a few weeks. Went to vet and they told me to stay away from grain free foods like this unless you absolutely have to use b because it causes heart issues. This is only good if you have a dog with grain allergies that has to have it.
customer_reviews.author: azpc35

customer_reviews.title: This seems to be a good product and my poochies love it
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a good product and my poochies love it. Have been buying on Amazon for a while now and appreciate the great service. This food does not have grain....or corn like a lot of other brands. Will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lois from Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Grain Free Dog Food
customer_reviews.text: Love this AFFORDABLE grain free dog food by Rachel Ray. My dog seems to like it as well. It has a low odor to it and I like the large bag sizes. I mix this 50/50 with the Rachel Ray Puppy version to help my elder dog maintain and/or gain weight (the weight gain come from the Puppy food).
customer_reviews.author: Megan M

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Changed to this dog food after our original dog food was no longer offered as a subscribe and save. After a short while I noticed that both of my aussie/border collie mix dogs had excessive itching, red/dry skin, and thinning of their coat. Tried various other solutions to help ease their discomfort before figuring out to switch out the dog food. Went out and bought a bag of their old food and in under a week their skin started to look healthier and they both just seem happier. Not sure what they were having an issue with in the food, but it was clearly the culprit for my pups ailments. Very disappointed in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Foster

customer_reviews.title: Dogs did not like
customer_reviews.text: dogs did not seem to like it, I do not have picky eaters but I also noticed the coat was not as shinny and after a few weeks they seemed to shed more. Have american bulldogs and have never had a problem with this before, changing back to my old brand
customer_reviews.author: Nanna B

customer_reviews.title: Larges pieces than I was expecting.
customer_reviews.text: I have tried multiple flavors of the Rachel Ray Nutrish food for my dog because she gets bored after one bag! (Just a little spoiled 😂) My dog is about 15 lbs and these pieces were larger than I expected and she had a harder time eating them. Will most likely switch back to smaller foods from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Purcell

customer_reviews.title: Our poor pup just would nibble on fish meal but her ...
customer_reviews.text: My furkid LOVES it!! We have tried everything out there that is grain free, chicken free. Our poor pup just would nibble on fish meal but her hair still would not grow back from all her allergies. Then I found this and not only does she have her fluffy hair back it looks great and she eats the whole bowl of kibble! We are VERY happy!
customer_reviews.author: ellen

customer_reviews.title: no Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Dog will not eat the food EVEN when I top it with chicken broth or deer broth, milk, yogurt etc.... Coyotes won't even it it after I dumped it outside!
customer_reviews.author: Spirit

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by vet!
customer_reviews.text: Bandit was rushed to the doggie emergency room because of difficulty breathing. Many tests later, it was discovered that he was having an allergic reaction to ingredients in other popular dog foods. We switched to this, and so far -- so good! At first, he resisted, but now he seems to like it. Thanks Rachel Ray! YUMMO!! :) I was happy to have it delivered to the door by Amazon to avoid hauling heavy bags from the store, and we will be back for more!
customer_reviews.author: J. Arena

customer_reviews.title: Great Food
customer_reviews.text: I switched my Chihuahua mix to this food several years ago. She loves the food. The kibbles are small. She has done much better on this food!
customer_reviews.author: Dee73

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great
customer_reviews.text: It's always hard to tell how a dog is doing on a new food until after she's been eating for a while, but I swear t think my dog's breath is better (it was awful). She likes it and it looks good to me. Plus I think the idea of getting rid of low nutritional value grains is a good one (I am sure there is literature on this)
customer_reviews.author: Bootsy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Just started my dogs on this food after discovering that my pittie has a grain allergy. I switched from the regular Rachel Ray food without any problems, and my dogs actually seem to prefer this kind :)
customer_reviews.author: Dev clark

customer_reviews.title: My sensitive pit bull loves it!
customer_reviews.text: The only food I have found so far that won’t cause my tan pit bull to get sick. The limited ingredients is very gentle on his stomach thank goodness! LOVE the subscription option so it comes straight to your door.
customer_reviews.author: Riana Skye

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Food for your Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This dog food gets very high reviews from reputable dog food critics. Grain free means fewer allergies for my pups. This is really one of the best dog foods, and the price is great on amazon!
customer_reviews.author: segal

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog happy owner.
customer_reviews.text: My dog seems to really like it, when she hears me opening the bag she gets super excited. There are no grains or fillers in it which made me happy. Reasonable price for the amount of dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Eiigna

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t give my dogs gas
customer_reviews.text: So, I have three dogs; red nose Pitt, Chihuahua and a rat terrier mix. My Chihuahua is picky and does not like this. To be honest, none of the dogs really care for it. If my heathens don’t drop them food then they will eat it this dried up unappealing nuggets. I haven’t canceled my subscription and that is why I keep getting it.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P

customer_reviews.title: My dog likes this food
customer_reviews.text: Just started using this brand a week ago and so far so good, my dog will eat it. I cannot comment on the flavor as I did not test it out :) and not sure how I would rate the freshness.
customer_reviews.author: slt

customer_reviews.title: I now love just ordering instead of having to go to store ...
customer_reviews.text: My boxer Petey loves this food. He has to have zero grain, zero corn. Loves the Turkey only. I have cervical spine problems. I now love just ordering instead of having to go to store and lift off shelf put in cart take out of cart put on belt put back in cart take out of cart put in trunk take out of trunk deal :)
customer_reviews.author: Vickie L Turner

customer_reviews.title: Full of bugs
customer_reviews.text: I just opened this bag and unfortunately it is full of ants...i usually wait this long to open but one of my dogs had surgery and was not eating much..i am past my return window and do not know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: cat bordas

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this good , he's been eating taste of the wild for 8 years I switched and he like this a lot . No more canned food for him either also taste of the wild. and I noticed his poops are very nice still. So far so good I figured Rachael would only put out quality dog food
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great nutritious food
customer_reviews.text: My granddogs love this food. It wasnt like they get at home but the liked this much better. It didnt cause any stomach problems to change to a new food which is a good sign.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Ising

customer_reviews.title: Start slow
customer_reviews.text: Had one dog on this for years with no issues. Tried it on another dog, and the poor thing developed explosive diarrhea. If switching to this brand, I recommend a 14 day transition, a good sense of humor, plenty of cleaning supplies and air freshener.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: MY DOG LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.text: SEEMS LIKE A GOOD FOOD FOR THE PRICE, THE INGREDIENTS WERE COMPARABLE TO A FOOD I USED TO BUY FROM THE VET FOR SIX TIMES THE PRICE, JAX LOVES IT!
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT FONCK JR.

customer_reviews.title: This food killed my dog!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog developed and died from DCM after eating this dog food for over one year. DO NOT feed your dog a grain free diet. It might kill your dog. It did mine.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: This dog food has solved my  Shih Tzu‘s digestive problem and he loves the taste.
customer_reviews.text: When I first got my little Shih Tzu, he would throw up and have diarrhea at least once a week. Since putting him on this dog food he has had no digestive problems at all and he loves the taste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and he likes it!
customer_reviews.text: This has decent ingredients and I like Rachel Ray and her donations, so I support her products in general. Oliver loves this food....but I put a little fish oil on it to help with his allergies...works great. No more itching!
customer_reviews.author: recycle-it

customer_reviews.title: He's licking and biting and his paws much less and seems to really like the food (he is a pug though
customer_reviews.text: My pug has a rough time with allergies, so we decided we were going to try to eliminate as many allergens as possible starting with his food. The price is affordable (unlike those other pet store brands) and it really helped with his allergies. He's licking and biting and his paws much less and seems to really like the food (he is a pug though, so he likes any food!). We've been using the food for about a year now and are pleased with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Cpeg2015

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love it, little stale last bag did not return due to covid19
customer_reviews.text: Usually dogs love food this last shipment food was stale. Dogs won’t eat it :( never had this issue before. We will continue to receive because never this issue before.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Pinson

customer_reviews.title: Good value, dog likes all but beef flavor
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes this flavor and this brand. She is allergic to corn. She is happy to eat it. She does not like the beef flavor. For some reason the beef flavor also gives her bad gas. The price is pretty good for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Anna Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Not for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog didn’t like this food. I had her on this food for 3 months. My dog was having weight problems due to her being picky. This was the 5th food I put her on. She would only nibble on it here and there. I added dyne to it to see if that would make her want to eat it. It helped a little, but not much. This food was also not recommended by my vet. I wouldn’t recommend this food for chihuahuas. My dog didn’t like it and it was not nutritional for her.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Brown

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: We switched our dogs to this food and they love it, grain free! Our oldest dog has more energy and less allergies
customer_reviews.author: Jenifer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading subscribe and save price
customer_reviews.text: I was purchasing this because of the subscribe and save price. After a few months of watching the price closely I decided to cancel since the advertised price was misleading.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Our dog's favorite!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog tends to get bored with all the other flavors, as in turns her nose up to them... she never even hesitates when I fill her bowl with Zero Grain.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Miller

customer_reviews.title: Bad Batch
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been feeding this to our dogs for over two years. But the most recent batch must not be good because neither of them barely want to eat it. Their eating habits have been totally uncharacteristic the past month. Nothing can account for two dogs both reluctantly eating the same food than a bad batch. I worry if it’s actually causing them harm internally or what. Both are way more lethargic. Kind of scary.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: This had my PitBull throwing it up after each time I fed it to him. No other food does this. Rachael Ray should get her name off this crap, or take an active interest in how it’s made.
customer_reviews.author: KajunDC

customer_reviews.title: Transitioned from raw diet to this. No regrets.
customer_reviews.text: My husky has had a sensitive stomach and was put on a raw diet. As he got older I wanted to transition to something more convenient and less time consuming. He becomes violently ill with most dog foods but he never got sick once with this. He only gained a little weight but overall he seems happy and healthy. His teeth look good, his coat looks good, he has a great deal of energy, and he loves to eat it.
customer_reviews.author: infinity

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: Our dogs love it and they all have better coats and more energy. We have a Lab, Lab mix, 2 cocker mixes and a Great Pyrenees mix. They love the taste and are thriving
customer_reviews.author: Jean Ford

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: My dog didn't really like it, but had no choice but to eat it. It usually sat in her bowl for several hours. She usually gobbles up the grain-free food.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Kamrad

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: I have a very picky eater at home and he is also 13 years old, so I want to give him the best nutrition. Lately, he has gotten to the stage where he vomits often. This food has certainly made his vomiting less frequent. Another thing I like about this food....when you add water to it, it does not BLOW UP the way junky dog foods do. Since there are no fillers and grains and such, it stays pretty small even when in water. (And in the dog's tummy)
customer_reviews.author: Nteres

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this food
customer_reviews.text: My dog preferred this over his food. I tried mixing it so he wouldn’t get sick from the change and he would dig out his food to eat this one.
customer_reviews.author: JOVANI VALDEZ

customer_reviews.title: Dogs refuse to eat it.
customer_reviews.text: For some reason both of my dogs turn their nose up at this and refuse to eat it. Yet when I go to the store they gobble it down. Cancelled subscription because apparently my beagles noses are not liking the freshness of the mail order.
customer_reviews.author: kathie Volante

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: My Huskies love it! One is a very finicky eater So I was concerned but she loves it! Have it on subscription now for delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Vince

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have switched dog food so many times in the last 8 years trying to find the best food for my pugs. This is absolutely the BEST dog food out there for my dogs. My pugs coats are so silky and soft(they were coarse before) and their allergies have disappeared.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and apparently tasty
customer_reviews.text: A Yorkie and a Cairn Terrier both love this food! The Yorkie is going on 14 years old and the Cairn is 7 years old. They are both in good health and I attribute a lot of that to the quality of this food. Believe me, I've tried a lot of different dog foods with them over the years and this one seems to suit their needs best!
customer_reviews.author: jeannel

customer_reviews.title: Allergies flared for our pug
customer_reviews.text: We were feeding our pug this grain free food, but she's been itching a lot lately. We're Trying PPP right now hoping it works for us.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: Our small-breed dogs love this food
customer_reviews.text: Our small-breed dogs love this food. We were buying other grain-free brands that were double the price for half the size, so I’m so happy I found this. The size of the food pieces is a little big for a 6lb dog, but we put a little water on it and he’s good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Jacks

customer_reviews.title: I've switched brands!
customer_reviews.text: I've been giving my dogs grain free dog food for two years now due to health reasons. I had been giving them Castor & Pollux Ultramix grain free formula, but, then we took in a foster. She is a "Labsky" and I had no idea how much a Lab eats. Anyway, my husky and Rottweiler would go through one 30 pound bag of food in two months. Now, I'm having to order one bag per month, and it's barely enough! So, I wanted to order a 15 pound bag of food to supplement what they already have. Well this has great ingredients, and the price is awesome! They like it even more, so, I switched!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Ward

product_meta.title: Rachael Ray Nutrish Zero Grain Dry Dog Food, Poultry Flavors, Grain Free
product_meta.description: Size:28 Lb. Bag| Color:Chicken & Sweet PotatoRachael Ray Nutrish Zero Grain Chicken & Sweet Potato Recipe dry dog food is made with simple, natural ingredients with added vitamins & minerals. Real U.S. farm-raised chicken is always the number one ingredient, combined with sweet potatoes, peas & cranberries. And there are never any grain, gluten or fillers ingredients
feature_bullets: Contains (1) 28 Pound Bag of Dry Dog Food
US farm-raised chicken is the 1 ingredient
No artificial flavors, colors, or artificial preservatives
Natural dog food with added vitamins & minerals
Safely USA cooked with the world's best ingredients
